abstract.text: The URL for the document’s backup file that was created during an autosave operation.

inlineContent.text: This property specifies the location of the backup file, if any. If a backup file cannot be created or is not needed, the value of this property is

Starting in OS X v10.8, document versions can be preserved using a backup file created during an autosave operation, which supports document versioning. This property gives you access to the backup file’s URL.
Using an autosave backup file for preserving versions is efficient. This is because an
instance is able to use the
option when it calls the
method. The document gets the value of this property twice during saving:
Before calling the
method: This is to check whether using the replace-by-moving option is possible and, if not, to allow the system to preserve data by instead using copying.
Within the
method: This is to discover where to put the backup file.
When you implement the
method with the
or
operation type, you must check this property’s value. If it is not
, move the previous contents of the file (that would be overwritten) to the URL’s location. The default implementation of
does this.
To create a backup file from within your custom implementation of the
method, call the
method
, using a backup item name of
and an option of
option. If your custom implementation is unable to keep the backup file, you must override this property and return
to ensure that the document’s file gets correctly preserved before it gets overwritten.
The default implementation of the
method returns a non-
value based on the value of
, but only if the document’s file needs to be preserved prior to saving or if the
method returns
. Otherwise, it returns

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An abstract class that defines the interface for macOS documents.
An operation that overwrites the document’s current contents with autosave data.
An operation that overwrites a document’s file or file package with the document’s contents.
Autosaves the document’s contents to an appropriate location in the file system.
Autosaves the document’s contents to an appropriate file-system location, as needed.
The URL for the document’s backup file that was created during an autosave operation.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether it is safe to autosave document changes.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the document has changes that have not been autosaved.
Returns whether the document subclass supports version management.
Schedules periodic autosaving for the purpose of crash protection.
Writes the contents of the document to a file or file package located by a URL.
A convenient interface to the contents of the file system, and the primary means of interacting with it.
Replaces the contents of the item at the specified URL in a manner that ensures no data loss occurs.
The backup item remains in place after a successful replacement.
Replace the contents of the specified file with the contents of the current version’s file.
A false value.
An object representing the location of a resource that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.

value.text: An object that represents the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
